intro: Ammocharis baumii, commonly known as the purple orchid lily, is a bulbous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple and white flowers. The plant produces a cluster of narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a bulbous base. It is typically grown as a decorative indoor plant due to its elegant appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements. Ammocharis baumii thrives in well-draining soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
